title: Is this the Huawei Mate 10? | Trusted Reviews
description:
![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**Huawei’s[Mate 9](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/huawei-mate-9) was a
great phone with a standout screen, but if we had one criticism it would be
the somewhat dull design.**

Luckily, if new renders are to be believed, it seems the Chinese company has
fixed that particular issue on its upcoming follow-up to the Mate 9: the Mate
10.

The renders were posted to Chinese social media site Weibo
([via](http://www.gsmarena.com/alleged_huawei_mate_10_renders_leak-
news-26757.php)) and appear to show the front and back of the upcoming phone,
complete with an edge-to-edge screen.

**Related:[Best smartphone](https://www.trustedreviews.com/guide/best-
smartphone)**

If the renders are indeed accurate, the almost full-face screen will be a
first for Huawei, with the small bezel at the top and bottom of the device
reminiscent of the [Galaxy S8](https://www.trustedreviews.com/samsung-
galaxy-s8-review)‘s design.

![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

Round the back, it seems we can expect to see a dual camera setup, complete
with the Leica branding Huawei has become known for.

echo-3607478 "Alexa’s new whisper mode rolls out in US today – here’s how to
enable it")

  * 

Below that setup there appears to be a fingerprint sensor, suggesting the
company is no closer to developing an in-display version than its larger
rivals Samsung and Apple.

![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

There also appears to be a brushed metal finish on the backplate of the phone,
further adding to the improved design.

This latest leak also came with some predictions for the internals, including
a Kirin 970 processor, 6.1-inch QHD display, and 6GB/64GB memory
configuration.

At this point, none of this has been confirmed, however, and the renders
themselves have not been verified as accurate, so take it all with a pinch of
salt.

![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

However, Huawei CEO, Richard Yu has previously confirmed the Mate 10, claiming
that it will be more powerful than the [iPhone
8](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/iphone-8-release-date-specs-rumours-
price-uk-2993101).

There’s no confirmed release date at this point, but rumours have speculated
that we’ll see the Mate 10 arrive in mid-October, possibly on the 16th.

**Let us know what you think of the renders on social media.**
